content:
Do we have anything in Backdrop for syntax highlighting? If not, we gonna port something from Drupal 7. What is the general consensus on which one is the best D7 module to port to Backdrop for xyntax highlighting?

Looking now at https://www.drupal.org/project/geshifilter, but maybe the majority of Backdrop users like another one?

I've just realized I needed to check https://backdropcms.org/project/codefilter instead of https://backdropcms.org/project/code. This module meets our needs for now, so please ignore the above question.
Sounds like you've got it solved but I'll suggest one more option and that is the markdown module. You could use the backticks if I recall correctly

@Alan Mels I wrote this module a while ago: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/highlightjs

backdrop-contrib/highlightjs
Integrates the highlight.js library to provide syntax highlighting for code blocks. - backdrop-contrib/highlightjs

BWPanda (Peter) said:

Alan Mels I wrote this module a while ago: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/highlightjs

Thank you very much for pointing to the right one!
